PR 179Collection processed by Larry WeimerNew-York Historical SocietyNew-York Historical Society170 Central Park WestNew York, NY 10024(212) 873-3400This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2022-08-02T14:23:46Finding aid written in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard The collection holds photographs; any text is in English.
New-York Historical Society
Norman Weisberg photographs
Weisberg, Norman, approximately 1930-
PR 179
4 Linear feet in 2 boxes and 1 flat file
1980s 24 panoramic photographs dating from the 1980s, all but one in color, taken by New York photographer Norman Weisberg (born circa 1930). The photographs include sweeping views from the Empire State Building and the "Top of the Rock" observation deck of Rockefeller Center, and panoramas focused on particular sites including Shea Stadium, Fulton Fish Market, Ellis Island, the World Trade Center, and others. For more information on making arrangements to consult the collection, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.
Arrangement
The photographs are listed in the container list in chronological order.
Biographical / Historical
Norman Weisberg, born circa 1930, is a panoramic photographer and publisher now living on Long Island, N.Y. He was editor of the photographic journal "The Panoramic Eye." In creating his images, Weisberg employed a globuscope, a spring loaded camera which exposes the film on a continuous roll, thereby creating images that begin and end with the same reference point.
Conditions Governing Access
For more information on making arrangements to consult the collection, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.
Conditions Governing Use
Taking images of documents from the library collections for reference purposes by using hand-held cameras and in accordance with the library's photography guidelines is encouraged. As an alternative, patrons may request up to 20 images per day from staff.
Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.
Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of the photographer, Norman Weisberg, in 2001 and 2018-2022.
Preferred Citation
This collection should be cited as the Norman Weisberg Photographs (PR 179), Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, New-York Historical Society.
Credit line: "Norman Weisberg, Panoramic Photographer, This is the way the world looks."
Processing Information
Two photographs in boxes 1 and 2, donated in 2001, were processed by Holly Hinman in August 2002. The other photographs, donated in 2018-22, were processed in February 2020, September 2021, and May, August 2022 by archivist Larry Weimer.
Scope and Contents
The collection consists of 24 panoramic prints, each of which is listed in the container list. Generally, the photographs include sweeping views from the Empire State Building and the "Top of the Rock" observation deck of Rockefeller Center, and panoramas focused on particular sites including inside Shea Stadium during the New York Mets' World Series championship year of 1986, Fulton Fish Market, Ellis Island, and the World Trade Center.
All the photos date from the 1980s. All but that of the Fulton Fish Market are in color. The size of the prints varies from about 65 inches in length to about 15 inches in length.
New York (N.Y.) -- Photographs. Cityscapes (representations) Panoramas (visual works) Ellis Island Immigration Station (N.Y. and N.J.) Empire State Building (New York, N.Y.) Rockefeller Center Shea Stadium (New York, N.Y.)
